content.question: A student wants to study the motion of an object that has a constant acceleration. Which of the following experiments could the student conduct to provide the best situations in which an object has a constant acceleration? Select two answers.

choices.label: Release a ball from rest near Earth’s surface.
Release a toy car from rest such that it travels along different looped sections of a track.
Launch a water-propelled rocket from rest such that it travels into the air and falls back to Earth’s surface.

Release a cart from rest such that it travels down an incline of <math alttext="40 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to the ground.

content.answer: Release a ball from rest near Earth’s surface.

skill.text: 3.A: Create experimental procedures that are appropriate for a given scientific question.
